name: Aaron 'Sween machine' Sweeney
description: Born in London. PhD Student in Computational Biology. Hobbies are chessboxing, Skateboarding, previously sponsored by Vans, Volcom, Eastpak amongst others

fights.description: Sharad Mishra wins via chess - checkmate

name: Albert 'boxbox' Zheng
description: Albert Zheng, or BoxBox, is an American League of Legends and Teamfight Tactics streamer known for his Riven plays. He played top lane for Velocity eSports until 2013, then focusing on his streams and cosplaying. His twitch following has reached 2 million, alongside the 1.37 million subscribers on his YouTube.

fights.eventName: LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship

fights.description: Sneha Sanjay wins via chess - timeout

fights.eventName: Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin

name: Alexander Bestuzhev
description: Candidate master of sports in Boxing. Champion of Russian Universities. Champion of the Russian Armed forces. The winner of the Cup of Russia and the International Cup Peter. Champion of Russia among professionals on a kickboxing. Master of sports in kickboxing. Level in chess - 2nd level.

name: Alexander Vassu
description: Alexander Vassu was a tough fighter in the recent years. This technical and clever boxer fought a whopping 200 boxing matches in his career. He won 5 Finnish Championships and that tells something about his talents. Recently, chess has become a part of his life and now he is ready to rise into the chessboxing ring. Vassu is an entertaining fighter, who have plenty of neat tricks in his sleeves.

name: Ali 'Myth' Kabbani
description: Ali Kabbani, better known as Myth, is an American YouTube live streamer and professional Fortnite Battle Royale player. As of July 2021, he has over 7.4 million followers and over 158 million views on Twitch. Kabbani also has over 4.5 million subscribers on his YouTube channel.

name: Aman 'Chessbrah' Hambleton
description: Aman Hambleton is a Canadian grandmaster, commentator, lecturer, and streaming superstar. He is a beloved chess entertainer and celebrity with a unique sense of humour and has a large following. Hambleton is one of the main hosts of ChessBrah, one of the most popular Twitch and YouTube chess channels. He has been a member of the PRO Chess League team, the ChessBrahs, since 2017 and has represented Canada in two Chess Olympiads.

name: Amin Babashev
description: Master of sports in kickboxing, candidate master of sports in Boxing, candidate master of sports in chess, silver medalist of the world championship in chessboxing.

fights.description: Sharad Mishra wins via chess - checkmate

name: Andre 'Glenzman' Glenzer
description: André runs his own cyber security business in Essen, Germany. His favourite chocolate bar is Rider or as it's known today, Twix.

name: Andreas 'Sardoche' Honnet
description: Andréas Honnet, or Sardoche, is a French former League of Legends professional, currently with Les Frères du Purgatoire as mid laner. Currently, Sardoche streams to 1.3 million followers, where he continues to play League of Legends, alongside TrackMania and Rocket League.

name: Andrew 'Komodo Dragon' Haworth
description: I was born on a bamboo floor of a bamboo shack in a small village in Indonesia.

name: Andrew 'The Fightin Philanthropist' McGregor
description: Andrew is a modern Renaissance man.  He is a photo-journalist who has also set up the Tiziano Project; a charity dedicated to supporting local journalism in war-torn countries. Andrew is also a comic book fan and publisher and loves super-heroes.  He also founded the LA Chessboxing Club and promotes chessboxing in the City of Dreams.  Andrew studied Philosophy at the University of Connecticut where he honed his chess-playing skills in the University team.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt
fights.description: Van Melick wins via boxing - TKO

fights.eventName: LACBO - Los Angeles Chessboxing Club Fight

name: Andrew 'ThePawnSlayer' Smith
description: Andrew started out life as a normal child. However, one day he was introduced to a board game that would change his life forever. Upon the first capture of a pawn, he developed an immediate thirst for slaying pawns. With each helpless pawn he captured, his mind began to alter. He became transfixed on ensuring that every pawn in the world was slayed! He decided that any chess player who dared to stand in his way of his continuous massacre, would face a swift and brutal demise.

name: Andy 'The Rock' Costello
description: Exeter-based Costello is a world class cage-fighter, and was a junior chess champion before giving up the game at the age of twelve to dedicate himself to martial arts.

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain

fights.description: Von Stauffenberg wins via boxing - disqualification

name: Anthony 'Toto' Bourached
description:
Sent back in time by a distopian war lord, Anthony likes to set his next target at ease by dancing to glam-soul. He often finds it hard to connect with humans but on the chessboard he is a machine and will sweep everything in his path. Born in a city riddled with crime and anger toward AI. Toto Bourached rose from the cogs of a dysfunctional machine to represent his bretherin. Realising that he could not restore the relationship between man and machine without understanding humans; Toto taught himself to understand, and interact with humans through the medium of dance.

Doing a PhD in Machine Learning and Neuroscience at UCL, Toto has been trained by the strongest chess AIs: Alpha Zero, Stockfish and Deep Blue. VIVA LA MACHINA!

fights.eventName: CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night

name: Arturas Lukosiunas
description:
Artūras is from Lithuania. He trained boxing from a young age. Chess enthusiast. Belongs to a fighters club "One Blood" in Lithuania. Has two sons who are fighters.
Artūras loves his dog. They often go for a run together.
Artūras participates in dog championships with his Cane Corso.

fights.description: Vesa Vaitulevicius wins via boxing - KO
Kumar Jha wins via boxing - TKO

name: Ben 'The Rumble' Robinson
description: Ben works as a warehouse manager and has just launched his own personal training company called Double “R” Fitness.  Ben is dedicated to keeping fit and reinventing old-school exercises routines such as the “Turkish Get-Up”  which is a kind of sideways sit-up with a heavy weight; basic training for all Turkish wrestlers 100 years ago.  Ben is relatively new to chess and has been preparing for tonight’s bout by staying up late and playing on the internet.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

fights.description: Kumar Jha wins via boxing - TKO

fights.eventName: CBGM - Investor Pitch event for TBWA
LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World
EVE Fanfest 2011: Brain Vs. Pain Chessboxing Match

fights.description: Van Melick wins via boxing - TKO

fights.eventName: LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship

name: Brian 'No Slack' Mak
description: A polyglot, Brian knows 7 languages. A child prodigy completed a university diploma in piano when he was just 15 years old - you could say he is an over achiever. Brian played his own entrance theme, Baker St on the saxophone last time out.

name: Bryan 'Singapore Slinger' Woon
description:
Woon is one of the toughest competitors on the London Chessboxing scene- a dedicated trainer with fitness to burn he has turned in two stellar performances both of which he lost narrowly by checkmate. His debut bout against Canada's Sean Mooney at the Royal Albert Hall in 2012 proved to be one of the most exciting ever seen by chessboxing crowds worldwide and his second bout against Germany's Tim Bendfeldt was another cracker.

He says: "I'm hooked [on chessboxing] because it pushes me to mental and physical exhaustion. The closer your body feels to shutting down and giving up from fatigue and pain, you realise the more alive you are."

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain

name: Cameron 'The Hurt Locker' Little
description: Cameron received his nickname doing his previous job dealing with unexploded ordnance (bombs). He's feeling fit ... ready for some action - BOOM, BOOM!!! A professional in ground investigations. Handy with a shovel. Got a probing jab. I'm sure you can think of something better than me.

fights.eventName: LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt

name: Chad 'Cherdleys' Lebaron
description: Chad Lebaron, also known by his YouTube channel name as Cherdleys, is an American actor and YouTuber who makes comedy skits and pranks on his channel "Cherdley's" along with other YouTubers and Comedians from the California area.

name: Charlie Hayter
description:
Charlie has been boxing for just six months and although he has played chess since childhood he has only recently begun to study the game seriously.  Until recently Charlie worked in the City specialising in solar energy investments, and is now doing finance things for an internet marketing start-up company.

Charlie used to live in South Africa where he worked on a game park and his dream is to return one day and manage his own safari business.  Charlie’s friend’s call him the ‘vainest man on earth’ because he spends so much time in the gym and in front of the mirror.  Charlie is also keenly interested in nutrition, real ale and pipe-smoking (though not when he’s in training).  His ambition is to one day grow a handlebar moustache.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

name: Chris 'Abroad in Japan' Broad
description: Chris Broad, or Abroad in Japan, is an English Youtuber that creates content on Japan after moving there whilst working as an Assistant Language Teacher. With 2.74 million subscribers, Broad’s Youtube Videos have amassed 402 million views over time.

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain
LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt
LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job

fights.description: Van Leest wins via chess - checkmate

fights.eventName: FISP - Italian middleweight title of chessboxing

name: Dan 'The Taxman' Manfold
description: Dan is the original fake 80's man and King of the Jocks. There are only two things in life you can rely on; death and taxes - this guy brings them both. A former tax associate and now work as a part time caterer, a part time chess coach, a part time debt adviser and a full time chess boxer. Dan describes himself as less of a Jock Talker and more of a Jock Doer. Legend has it that he eats only raw eggs and runs ten miles barefoot every day. He was a tax accountant and is now starting his second master's degree. He is loved by few, hated by many but feared by all. The bringer of all that is certain in life, Death and Taxes.

name: Dan Hall
description: I was U14, U15 and U16 British Chess Champion - got back into Chess during lockdown after not really playing for many years. Was Head of Maths and moving into Audit. Hoping I don't get knocked out.

fights.eventName: EVE Fanfest 2011: Brain Vs. Pain Chessboxing Match

name: Daniel 'The Man From Pamplona' Lizarraga
description: Chessboxing is a beautiful sport. I’ve fought in a lot of different countries and met many wonderful people and made many friends. I hope to do my best to put on a good show and to try to win the fight, but most importantly to have a great experience.

fights.eventName: LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World
Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin

name: Daniele Giulio 'Dada' Rota
description: Daniele is from Milan, loves death metal music, chess and Muay Thai.

fights.description: Zarein Dolab wins via chess - submission

name: Daniil Solovyov
description: This young and talented chessboxer, from Russia, was immediately recognised when he debuted in Berlin. He is strong in chess and throws hard punches with his long reach in the ring. Thus it was not a surprise when he earned his Amateur World Championship title in 2017. Daniil is very athletic as besides being a successful chessboxer, he is also a triathlonist.

name: David 'Double D' Depto
description: Professionally, the trained economist with an IQ of 140 is a manager of a large concern in the pharmaceutical industry.

fights.eventName: LACBO - Los Angeles Chessboxing Club Fight

name: David 'Northern Powerhouse' Jarmany
description: David "Northern Powerhouse" Jarmany was originally a chess player, but has been described on BBC Radio 5 Live as "stacked". The man from Blackburn has lived in London for a number of years and constantly tries to convert the Southerners into pronouncing things in the proper Northern way. An accountant by trade, the Northern Powerhouse often can be seen throwing a double jab as a double entry point. It all balances out in the end.

fights.eventName: LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt

fights.description: Rodrguez Vega wins via chess - checkmate

name: Dimitry 'The Kid' Pechurin
description: Russia is well known of its master chess players and (almost) unbeatable boxers, who's names are written in the stars. All this said, Dimitry is a new generation fighter, who has successfully combined the Russian legacy of chess and boxing. This heavyweight fighter is sharp as a knife and furious as a bear, but once he sets his foot outside the ring he is very calm and nice to everyone who he happen to meet. Helsinki is lucky to have this mighty chessboxer from Moscow. Добро пожаловать.

name: Dmitry Ermakovich
description: A graduate of the world champion on Boxing under version WBC Silver, four-time champion of Europe among professionals, world-class athlete Sergey Rabchenko.

fights.eventName: CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup

name: Dymer 'Beast of Peace' Agasaryan
description:
I started playing chess when I was 6 year old, but after 2 years I quit and at 13 years old I started boxing. Then I heard about chessboxing in my last year of school, one of my classmates told me and I went back home, searched chessboxing online and applied via the form. When I got my Lithuanian citizenship I came to London to visit my best friend and together we went to a chessboxing session at the Islington gym. After the session Tim, the boxing coach and I went in outside and after a couple minutes talking one of them said: "we have a new world champion" and it happened 6 months later....
I am the only one in Chessboxing who became a world Champion in three different weight classes (Lightweight, Welterweight, Middleweight) and I did it simultaneously.

fights.eventName: LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship
LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt

name: Egor Vlasov
description: Egor is a scholar of legendary chessboxer Marat Shakhmanov and member of the Moscow Chess Boxing Club. He learned chess in chess club Sokolniki.

fights.description: Onder Guzel wins via boxing - TKO

name: Emma Richardson
description:
Emma studied Art at London University and is an expert sculptor.  She took a post-graduate degree in teaching and currently works as a teacher at a primary school in Exeter.  It was while training in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu that she heard about chessboxing and decided to give it a go. Emma was keen schools chess player but gave it up when she discovered rock music and alcohol.  Now thanks to her interest in chessboxing she’s dusted off the books and picked up the game again.
Hobbies:  riding her classic Triumph motorbike.  Building  and sculpting sandcastles on Exmouth beach.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

name: Eric 'PointCrow' Morino
description: Eric Morino, or PointCrow, is famous for his YouTube speedrun videos and further through his Twitch streams, with 1.34 million subscribers and 485k followers respectively. Famous for the Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, PointCrow has now diversified his content.

name: Felix 'Intense' Li
description:
- Born in Hong Kong, moved to the UK when I was 11 years old.
- Works as a Product Owner at a startup called MyMiniFactory which is an online ecosystem for 3D printing enthusiasts and 3D Modelers.
- Has 3 Degrees, an MA at the Royal College of Art, MSC at Imperial College (MA / MSC both in design) and BEng in Mechanical Engineering at Imperial College.
- Plays Kabaddi for England, has had 2 international matches against Poland and Kenya. Was trying to gain weight and bulk for Kabaddi since there is only one weight class at 85kg. During the lockdown went from 65kg all the way to 83kg all the way back down to 70kg for this fight...
- Was seriously into chess and ranked within 10 ten in Hong Kong for my age group at 8 years old, but then moved to the UK at age 11 and didn't play/ study/ improved very much until chessboxing in May

fights.eventName: CBCB - Club Fights at Chess Boxing Club Berlin Gym
CBGM - Investor Pitch event for TBWA

name: Frank 'Anti Terror' Stoldt
description: Stoldt has previously fought in 25 boxing matches and was the kickboxing champion of Berlin. He has been an active chessboxer since 2005 and has a chess Elo rating of 2000. He is a police officer and is currently training police forces in Kosovo on behalf of the United Nations. He completed his boxing training in the truly authentic atmosphere of an Albanian boxing club.

fights.description: Pierre Paul wins via chess - timeout

name: Gearoid 'Sex Appeal' Veale
description: He is so attractive that he's been known to send women, men and some larger mammals into zombie like states of lust. When faced with this level of sex appeal, sexual preference becomes meaningless. Gearoid had to wear a paper bag over his head just to make it to the venue without any marage proposals. Exposure to the internet at young age stunted his emotional growth to the point when asked to write a short bio he spend 5 mins writing it and the remaining day drawing a picture of himself as a train.

name: George 'Huggy Bear' Crespo
description:
One of the founder members of  London Chessboxing and a fast developing talent, also known as 'Jorge'. George's strengths are his dynamism and fitness in the ring his two bouts so far have ended in defeat on the chessboard.

"I Started playing chess when I joined the chessboxing club in 2009. I’m probably more of a boxer than a chess player but I do love chessboxing and I think it can be a brilliant way for young people to develop and learn new skills."

fights.eventName: LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job
LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain

name: Gerard 'Ripper' Reilly
description: A Geography teacher - his atritional boxing style matches his favourite type of coastal erosion. This pugilistic pedagogue believes in fate and moved form Dublin to England on a coin toss. Grew up in Dublin. Learned to play chess to get out of a geography lessons in secondary school, ironically he is Geography teacher now! Strangest thing to happen to me was I had a moth removed from my ear and had to wait 4 days until a specialist ear doctor could remove it. Moved to England on a coin flip to decide between a job in England or Spain! England won despite best out of 5. Hobbies include, chess, tae kwon do, Guinness,

name: Gerry 'The Pacemaker' Anderson
description: Born in Glasgow but made in London, when he's not downing pints he's downing kings. The only thing he loves more than some good honest chess is being punched in the face. He's an evil Scotsman and causing pain is his game. This isn't his first venture into niche sports, having played shinty for England (but only because they were short on players...). He's ready to take your bishop and grind you down.

fights.eventName: World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night

fights.description: Di Vece wins via chess - checkmate

name: Gianpiero Sportelli
description: A good chess player and former Italian champion of Muai Thai (Thai boxing) and former European champion and world champion in K1

fights.eventName: World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night
LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job
LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt

fights.description: Van Melick wins via chess - timeout

name: Hubert 'The Wardrobe' Van Melick
description: Hubert is the original London Chessboxer – the first man through the door when the club opened in April 2008.  Since then he has competed three times, winning his debut bout against Mexico’s Hector Gomez, and following that up with an impressive stoppage against Bob “The Red Kite” Innes.    Last year he suffered an unlucky and unexpected defeat against London Chessboxing  founder, Tim Woolgar.   Hubert has been studying chess since he started chessboxing and has improved dramnatically in the last two years. He works for Amnesty International in Amsterdam as a project co-ordinator and his ambition is to become chessboxing world champion.  Little known fact: Hubert studied Marxist Economics at London University and thinks Communism should be give a second chance.  He supports Arsenal and Ajax FC.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt
fights.description: Van Melick wins via boxing - TKO
Van Melick wins via chess - checkmate
Van Melick wins via boxing - TKO
Van Melick wins via chess - timeout

name: Iepe 'The Joker' Rubingh
description: Iepe B. T. Rubingh (17 August 1974 – 8 May 2020) was a Dutch performance artist, athlete and the founder of chess boxing and World Chess Boxing Organisation (WCBO, with central Berlin, Germany in 2003)

fights.eventName: CBCB - Club Fights at Chess Boxing Club Berlin Gym

name: Isidro Gete
description: My first experience with chessboxing was when I fought Matt Read in 2010, which was after I had just taken part in a 24-hour blitz chess marathon so it was challenging to say the least. The game finished in a draw and I won narrowly on points. Matt is a tough opponent but I look forward to sharing the ring with him again.

fights.eventName: LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World
LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World

name: Jason 'Mayhem' Miller
description: Jason Nicholas Miller best known as Mayhem Miller is an American mixed martial arts fighter and TV host. Miller coaches fighters in Irvine, California at Mayhem Martial Arts and has trained extensively with Kings MMA in Huntington Beach, California. He has fought in the UFC, Strikeforce, WFA, WEC and DREAM. Miller was the host of MTV's reality series Bully Beatdown.

name: Jeremy 'Disguised Toast' Wang
description: Jeremy Wang, better known as Disguised Toast, is a Taiwanese-Canadian streamer, YouTuber, and Internet personality. He got his start on YouTube, creating videos about the digital card game Hearthstone.

fights.eventName: CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup

name: Jon 'The Brick' Wood
description:
Jon was a brick layer for 20 year, he has also worked for a travelling circus in the southern states of America. He is currenly an Architect, something he has always wanted to do ever since his time playing in the sand pit at school.
Militant Cyclists. I hunt down and damage every car that passes too close to me- obviously a lie, that would be a life times work in itself, Rather I content myself with hurling a monstrous stream of abuse at them. This usually does the trick although sometimes means we have to dance round their car slapping each other.
His hero is Muhammed Ali. Jon is engaged to be married. Jon was born in the year of the Cockerel.

name: Jonathan 'The Tactician' Arnott
description: UKIP MEP Arnott is a strong club level chess player. He fits boxing training around his duties annoying fellow MEPs in Brussels.

fights.eventName: LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt
World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night

fights.description: Rodrguez Vega wins via chess - checkmate

fights.eventName: LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World
LACBC - Chessboxing for Charity: Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Philanthropy
CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night

name: Kai 'The Man from Helsinki' Salminen
description: 45 years old, born in and grew up in a suburb in eastern part of Helsinki. I started chessboxing in spring 2016 and took my first chessboxing fight in November 2016 in Berlin. It was my first competition fight of any sport. I did train boxing as a teenager with my friends in a public sport hall over a quarter of a century a go, before conscript service. I have worked different kinds of security jobs and security & safety related jobs for the last 25 years. Currently I do not have much time for other hobbies besides chessboxing. Occasionally I make time to visit archery and shooting ranges. I try to find time to spend in forest hiking and sometimes camping, but I haven’t had much time for it for the last couple of years.

fights.eventName: CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night

name: Karl 'Ouch' Strugnell
description: Karl Ouch learnt to play chess on Skid Row in LA, hustling for money. He then went on to hustle on Venice beach before competing in his first chessboxing bout in 2013. He is so confident about his chess abilities that has been know to do press ups between chess moves.

fights.eventName: CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night
World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night
LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job

name: Kath Dobson
description: Kath played for her school chess team and also studied Judo at school.  She now lives in Exeter with a Royal Marine Commando and trains in various martial arts including Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, Muay Thai and chessboxing.  She studied English at the University of Swansea and has a special interest in Classical Greek and Ancient Egytpian civilisations.  Kath works in financial services. Her hobbies include tap-dancing, painting and fast-cars.  She has an irrational fear of Daddy-long Legs.  She dislikes hummus and cucumbers.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

name: Keith Kolbe
description: Hailing from La Verne, California Keith Kolbe joined the US Navy when he was 25 and trained in electronics, in which he has had steady interest ever since.  After a five year tour of duty which took him right round the world twice, Keith was honourably discharged. He ‘currently’ works for a company which specialises in charging units for electric cars – and can talk about AC-DC, resistors and ohms for a very long time.  He has been studying martial arts for about 10 years off and on, mostly to keep fit. When not playing with high-voltage equipment, boxing, or playing chess he enjoys home brewing, playing guitar and partaking of the fruits of his home brewing.  His most interesting beer is called ‘The Beast – it is 17per cent alcohol.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

fights.description: Kumar Uppalapu wins via chess - timeout
Sneha Sanjay wins via chess - checkmate

fights.eventName: FISP - Public exhibition of chess boxing at Mongrando EXPO

name: Konrad Rikardson
description: Boxed for Cambridge in the Varsity Match against Oxford, and swapped pawns with the likes of IM Harriet Hunt in the University chess club

name: Kris 'Toph' Aldenderfer
description: Toph is a Twitch streamer with 37 thousand followers from Singapore. Previously, he was a Super Smash Bros professional, maining Melee Fox, but is known for his commentating work alongside Super Smash Bros player Scar. Fluent in Japanese, Toph has also commentated in competitions hosted in Japan.

name: Lars 'Lazarus' Bjorknas
description:
Lars debuted internationally as the first Finnish chessboxer in 2014, as he represented the Finnish Chessboxing Club in Berlin. Since then he has always raised his hand when a Finnish chessboxer – bear sized – has been inquired to face an opponent. This heavyweight chessboxer is also known for being respectful to other people and he always offers his helping hand to anyone in need. 

​His fighter name was given to him by his peers, who were inspired by Lars "if you fall, you just stand up and continue fighting" state of mind, which he seems to apply not only inside but also outside the ring.

fights.eventName: LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt

name: Lawrence Trent
description: Lawrence Trent is a British International Master chess player and personality, but perhaps more famously known for his commentating work on some of the biggest FIDE tournaments and the London Chess Classic. Currently, he works as the commentator for major tournaments hosted by the chess platform Chess24. From 2015-2017, Trent managed World Champion challenger, GM Fabiano Caruana.

fights.description: Pierre Paul wins via chess - timeout

fights.eventName: Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin
CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night
CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup
World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night

name: Marc 'The Essex Bomb' Sidwell
description: Exploding out of Brentwood, Marc "Essex Bomb" Sidwell is also a wine model and magazine editor. He’s the face of the 2018 Riesling for Renegade Wine in Bethnal Green ("Marc" is delicious: just like him it's slightly dry with hints of apricots, poetry, lime and jasmine). He's worked for City AM, the New Statesman and the Telegraph.

fights.eventName: FISP - Italian middleweight title of chessboxing
LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship

name: Matt 'Crazy Arms' Read
description: He is the world’s most prolific chessboxer, having fought an increadible 31 times. He has the craziest arms in the world of sport with a wing span of 2 meters. Often known as Lazy Arms by the crowd due to his distinctly pedestrian punch output. His specialty is a lethally quick playing style as he hopes to avoid any unnecessary boxing rounds due to a poor training discipline. Chessboxing's answer to Mr Tickle, boasting the longest and craziest arms in the sport. Matt is an editor at Chess Magazine.

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain

name: Matt 'Matador' Thomas
job: Director of Brawl for a Cause

name: Matthew 'The Minotaur' Coldwell
description: Look into the abyss of those cruel, blue eyes. He doesn't know fear. He only sees fear. He smells your hesitation. And he will stop at nothing to ensure the fateful union of your king/face with his fist. There is no telling what he may do next. No attack is too brazen, no sacrifice too unsound, and there shall not be a millisecond of respite, nor glimmer of mercy. Prepare for the worst.

name: Max 'Jock Talk' Gershfield
description:
Rumours are that he hates nerds so much, that he taught himself chess in order to get in the boxing ring with them.
He comes from a rich, privileged family, he's wearing monogrammed shorts and a Jock Strap that just says Talk.
The only student to be voted Prom King for five consecutive years due to being held back at graduation.
In his spare time he loves giving wedgies, wet willies, and whipping people with towels.
Living in Amsterdam, training at the Mejiro Gym

fights.eventName: CBGM - Investor Pitch event for TBWA

fights.description: The Technician wins via chess - timeout

name: Mike 'The Bedfordshire Bull' Botteley
description: Mike is one of the strongest chessplayers in the London Chessboxing team and ranks among the most popular. His bulldog boxing style and deft chess play have won him many fans since his debut in March 2012.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

fights.description: Onder Guzel wins via boxing - TKO

name: Nathan Stanz
description: Nathan Stanz is a Streamer, Youtuber and Co-Founder of the creative studio collective named OFFBRAND. Stanz has a professional career in managing gaming collectives, alongside streaming in the Just Chatting channel.

fights.eventName: Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin

name: Nicolas Mildenstein
description: A former McKenzie fellow, Mildenstein is a business developer for Bayer, and laid the foundation for the very first business plan of Chess Boxing Global. Originally from the Chess Boxing Club Berlin he now trains at Kurze Rippe in Cologne.

name: Nikita 'Razor' Evstafiev
description: Nikita Evstafiev lives in Kostroma, Russia. He is the perfect example of a chessboxer, as he is a candidate master of sports in boxing as well as chess. In 2018, he won the amateur world championship and already became the Moscow Champion twice. Nikita works as a chess coach and has a University degree in economics. His hobbies include reading and traveling the world. His favorite boxer is former professional world champion Dmitry Pirog and his favorite chess player is Aleksander Alekhine.

fights.eventName: Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin
LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship
LSBF - First Lithuanian Open Chess Boxing Championship

name: Otto 'Bismark' Vihera
description:
Otto has a fighter spark in his eyes, which can expand into a devastating fire inside the boxing ring. This power was released in his first fight, when he knocked-out his opponent in 20 seconds. The chessboxing community is very eager to see him again in the ring.

​

His fighter name ‘Bisse’ is an shortened version of the historical person Bismarck, which is also used in local bars, as it means beer in Finnish.

fights.description: Onder Guzel wins via boxing - TKO
Onder Guzel wins via boxing - TKO

name: Pablo Hatz
description: Pablo is the prodigy kid of the Chess Boxing Club Berlin, trained by boxing trainer Jesus who caressingly calls him his Pablito.

fights.description: Van Melick wins via chess - checkmate
Kumar Uppalapu wins via chess - timeout

name: Peter 'Actuator' Crowley
description: Peter is able to calculate your life expectancy based on lifestyle within 42 seconds using only a slide rule. He has written a book on how those pesky bankers created the 2008 financial crisis - BOOOOOO! He entertains people in the pub by playing the piano. He supports Arsenal and is a Gooner!

fights.eventName: LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job

name: Rasel 'Razzle Dazzle' Alam
description: A man stuck in the 2000's grabbing life by the ears

fights.eventName: LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World
CBCB - Club Fights at Chess Boxing Club Berlin Gym

name: Richard 'The Berzerker' Evans Lacey
description: Born and raised in Norway. Initially trained as a hairdresser but didn't like the small talk. Enrolled at Berserker University and gained a 2.1 degree. Joined a graduate programme under Ragnar Lothbrok and was part of the first raiding party to East Anglia in 865. Taught chess by a monk who he met on a work night out. Loved it here so much he decided to stay.

name: Richard 'The Razor' Frazer
description: Richard designs computer generated graphics for some of your favourite shows like Peaky Blinders. In his last chessboxing fight he lost to Daniele Rota in the first round of chess and is determined to make amends! He loves tatting his torso and growing his beard to excessive proportions when he's not fighting.

fights.eventName: LCB - Heavyweight Decider 2011: Bobby Fischer Belt

name: Ricky 'Slick' Brown
description: I’m studying to be a teacher since I retired from the armed forces and chessboxing I find is a great combination of intellectual and physical challenges which really appeals to me. I’ve had many exciting experiences in my life and chessboxing is certainly one of the best. I have a tonne of respect for everyone who takes part and I hope that one day I will be challenging for a world title.

fights.eventName: LCB - Season Finale 2012: Spain vs. The World

fights.description: Sah Cindir wins via boxing - TKO

fights.eventName: CBCB - Club Fights at Chess Boxing Club Berlin Gym

name: Roger 'Cannonball' Baxter
description: Originally hailing from Sheffield, where he is currently undertaking a PhD in the history of technology and crime, now fighting out of London. 'Currently undertaking a PhD in the history of technology and crime - originally from the Steel City of Sheffield, now fighting out of Islington Boxing Club, please welcome the ginger ninja, Roger, 'The Cannonball', Baxter'

name: Roman 'Fighting Scorpion' Molarishvili
description:
Roman Molarishvili @teamlomaboxing "Fighting Scorpion" from the city of Chelyabinsk began to play chess in kindergarten 

During my student years in 2013, the future chess boxer visited the kickboxing and boxing section. It has been 8 years since these sports have become an integral part of Molarishvili's life 

 “I exercise for myself, for my soul, because I like it, this is how I live,” Roman says.

And I found out about chessbox by chance: on a search online, I found the Chelyabinsk Region Chess Federation, met the coach and began to develop in this direction.

fights.eventName: LACBC - Chessboxing for Charity: Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Philanthropy

name: Sakari 'Horse Attack' Lahderinne
description:
Sakari Lähderinne is the chessboxing World Champion in the 75 kg weight class. Having won gold in India (2018) and in Turkey (2019) he is considered to be the leading chessboxer in his division. 

His fighter name ‘Sakkematti’ is a clever hybrid of his nickname ‘Sakke’ and of the Finnish word ‘checkmate’. This nice and relaxed fellow, who found the time to answer to a few questions truly knows how to think fast and hit hard.

fights.eventName: CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup

name: Sean 'The Machine' Mooney
description: Former Ivy League student-athlete, current unprofessional soccer player, boxer of the chess & white collar varieties, Mount Everest summiteer.   I'm always happy to take a few punches if it helps raise some money for a great charity like Oracle Cancer Trust. Why chessboxing? The number one fighting sport combined with the number one thinking sport. Why not? Whenever people hear about chessboxing, they always have questions. My first was, "Where can I sign up". What's yours?

fights.description: Sah Cindir wins via boxing - TKO

fights.eventName: CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup
CBOI - 2ND WCBO Indian Open Chessboxing World Cup

name: Shayan 'Shah' Zarein Dolab
description:
Know as the king of Persia, all kneel before this Anglo-Iranian monarch appointed by God! A professional landlord by trade, although he doesn't enjoy putting your rent up, he does enjoy the finer things in life that it affords him. Anglo-Iranian with bags of combat sport experience including Kung Fu, Karate, kickboxing and Wrestling. 
Has a Masters Degree in Computer Hacking. 
Fluent in Persian.

fights.description: Zarein Dolab wins via chess - submission
Di Vece wins via chess - checkmate

fights.eventName: CBGM - Investor Pitch event for TBWA

fights.description: Van Leest wins via chess - checkmate

fights.eventName: LACBC - Chessboxing for Charity: Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Philanthropy

name: Steve 'Demon' Philp
description: Steve's is a determined competitor with a tough chin and an ability to think clearly under pressure. He lists his favourite boxer as Floyd Mayweather and aims to emulate his skilful style. His chessboxing career began in 2013 when he defeated George Crespo by time-penalty in a hotly contested bout.

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain
World Chessboxing Championships 2014 - Intellectual Fight Night

name: Tero 'El Toro' Weckroth
description: Tero is a founding member of the Finnish Chessboxing Club and the organiser of the first Nordic Chessboxing Fight Night in 2021. He has dual professional skillsets, pharmaceuticals and finance. This is demonstrated in both education, work career and in his current activity as a business angel. Unfortunately his dualism does not reach to chess, where he was roundly beaten by Crazy Arms in his only international fight 2016 in London.

name: Terry 'The Fighting Fireman' Marsh
description: Undefeated IBF World Light Welterweight Champion

fights.eventName: LCB - International Chessboxing 2014 The Italian Job
LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain
Battle of the Cities London vs Berlin

name: Tim 'Hippo' Woolgar
description: Tim is the Godfather of Chessboxing and has been running London Chessboxing since 2008 when he took part in the first ever chessboxing bout in the UK. Tim's nickname "The Hippo" is born out of his bad temper, peg-like teeth and questionable personal hygiene, although hippos are actually very clean animals. Modern genetic science has discovered that hippos and whales share the same decendants. Hippos came back onto land slimming down from many tens of tonnes to one or two. Much like his mammalian counter part, Tim is know for his dieting and his ability to slim down in a matter of weeks.

fights.eventName: LCB - Grand Prix Season Opener 2013 Brain vs Pain
CBP - Intellectual Fight Club - Chessboxing Night

name: Toby 'Slowby' White
description:
Still single.
The current holder of the Brexit Belt, he hit a UKIP MEP so hard that his whole party collapsed. Tonight he hopes to obtain a real, tangible belt.
Like his party of choice, the Liberal Democrats, he predicts he shall almost certainly come third in this contest of two, but he intends to look damn good doing so.
Once played rugby against Prince Harry.

fights.eventName: LCB - Pity The Fool 2016 Brexit Belt
LACBC - Chessboxing for Charity: Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Philanthropy

name: Tuukka Repo
description: When one might be thinking about the next Finnish MMA megastar, Tuukka Repo is by far among the first names, which you should think of. This hard-hitting 24-year-old raging head has already raced to win silver in the amateur world championships, which after his professional career has kicked off with 7 clear wins out of 8 fights. Tuukka is an outspoken and entertaining contestant, whose hardness can be felt among the entire audience.
